ЁЯСС
Elara

Reign: c. 2nd Century BCE
A famous early Chola king who conquered Sri Lanka and ruled from Anuradhapura for about 44 years. In the Sri Lankan epic 'Mahavamsa', although depicted as an invader, he is remembered as 'Manu Neethi Cholan'тАФa king so renowned for his justice that he even executed his own son to deliver justice for a cow.

ЁЯМК
Karikala

Reign: c. 190 CE
The greatest Chola emperor of the Sangam era. His name means 'man with the burnt leg'. He defeated a powerful confederacy of 11 rulers, including the Chera and Pandya kings, in the Battle of Venni, establishing Chola supremacy.

ЁЯПЧя╕П
Karikala's Legacy

Karikala is credited with the construction of the Kallanai (Grand Anicut) dam, one of the world's oldest water-regulator structures for flood control and irrigation on the Kaveri River, which is still in use today. He developed Puhar (Kaveripattinam) into a major port city and converted forest land into arable land.
